title: Lithium metal battery with mixed electrolyte system

events.title: Application filed by GM Global Technology Operations LLC

classifications.description: Rocking-chair batteries, i.e. batteries with lithium insertion or intercalation in both electrodes; Lithium-ion batteries
Accumulators with non-aqueous electrolyte characterised by the materials used as electrolytes, e.g. mixed inorganic/organic electrolytes
Liquid materials characterised by the solvents
Electrodes based on mixed oxides or hydroxides, or on mixtures of oxides or hydroxides, e.g. LiCoOx
Esters of carbonic or haloformic acids
Organic electrolyte characterised by the solvent

abstract: An electrochemical cell includes a lithium-containing negative electrode and an electrolyte system. In one variation, the electrolyte system includes a first liquid electrolyte, a solid dendritic barrier layer, and an interfacial layer. The solid dendrite barrier is ionically conductive and electrically insulating. The dendrite barrier layer includes a first composition and a second, different composition. The dendrite barrier layer has a shear modulus at 23°C of greater than or equal to about 7.5 GPa. The interfacial layer is configured to be in contact with a negative electrode including lithium metal on a first side and a dendrite barrier layer on a second opposite side. The interface layer includes a second liquid electrolyte, a gel polymer electrolyte, or a solid electrolyte. A dendrite barrier layer is disposed between the first liquid electrolyte and the interface layer.
abstract_original: 一种电化学电池包括含有锂的负极和电解质体系。在一个变型中，电解质体系包括第一液体电解质、固体枝晶阻挡层和界面层。固体枝晶阻挡层是离子导电的并且是电绝缘的。枝晶阻挡层包括第一组分和不同的第二组分。枝晶阻挡层具有在23℃下的大于或等于约7.5GPa的剪切模量。界面层被配置为与在第一侧上包括锂金属和在第二相对侧上包括枝晶阻挡层的负极相接触。界面层包括第二液体电解质、凝胶聚合物电解质或固态电解质。枝晶阻挡层设置在第一液体电解质和界面层之间。
claims:
1. An electrolyte system for an electrochemical cell, the electrolyte system comprising:
      a first liquid electrolyte;
      a solid dendrite barrier that is ionically conductive and electrically insulating and includes a first component and a second, different component, the dendrite barrier having a shear modulus greater than or equal to 7.5GPa at 23 ℃; and
      an interface layer configured to interface with a negative electrode comprising lithium metal on a first side and with the dendrite barrier layer on a second, opposite side, the interface layer comprising a second liquid electrolyte, wherein the dendrite barrier layer is disposed between the first liquid electrolyte and the interface layer.
2. The electrolyte system of claim 1 wherein the first component comprises a solid ceramic, glass, or glass-ceramic and the second component comprises a polymer.

3. The electrolyte system of claim 2 wherein the polymer comprises polyethylene oxide and the solid ceramic, glass or glass-ceramic is selected from the group consisting of: lithium aluminum titanium phosphate, lithium lanthanum titanate, lithium lanthanum zirconium oxide, lithium phosphorus sulfide, and combinations thereof.
4. The electrolyte system of claim 1 wherein the dendrite barrier layer has a composite structure comprising the first component and the second component.
5. The electrolyte system of claim 1 wherein the dendrite barrier layer has a laminate structure including one or more layers of the first component and one or more layers of the second component.
6. The electrolyte system of claim 1 wherein the dendrite barrier layer is impermeable to the first liquid electrolyte.
7. The electrolyte system of claim 1 further comprising a polymer membrane disposed between the first liquid electrolyte and the dendrite barrier layer.
8. The electrolyte system of claim 1 wherein the interfacial layer comprises an ether-based electrolyte.
9. The electrolyte system of claim 1 wherein the first liquid electrolyte is configured to be disposed between the solid dendrite barrier layer and a positive electrode comprising a metal oxide.

10. The electrolyte system of claim 9 wherein the first liquid electrolyte is a carbonate-based electrolyte selected from the group consisting of: ethylene carbonate, propylene carbonate, butylene carbonate, fluoroethylene carbonate, dimethyl carbonate, diethyl carbonate, ethyl methyl carbonate, and combinations thereof.
